entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 9.5.25
entry.summary: Sutherlin School District Superintendent Terry Prestianni talked about things happening this fall as the Back to School series continues

entry.title: Emigrant Fire prompts forest closures near Roseburg
entry.summary: Umpqua National Forest has announced an emergency closure order for the Emigrant Fire, according to the Umpqua National Forest.

entry.title: Umpqua National Forest Issues Emergency Closure for Emigrant Fire
entry.summary: Umpqua NF has issued an emergency closure for the Emigrant Fire, effective Sept. 4–Nov. 25. Several trails, campgrounds & roads are closed, while others remain open. Fire danger is HIGH with PURs & IFPL at Level 2. Full details: fs.usda.gov/r06/umpqua/alerts

entry.title: DFPA WORKING ON LIGHTNING RECONNAISSANCE FOLLOWING STORM
entry.summary: September 4, 2025 11:10 a.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association has been actively involved in lightning reconnaissance and initial attacks following a prolonged lighting storm that began at approximately 5:00 p.m. on Wednesday. DFPA Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said the storm resulted in 76 registered strikes. Pope said overnight crews responded to 14 smoke...

entry.title: DFPA Crews Respond to Lightning Strikes Across Douglas County
entry.summary: DFPA crews are responding after 76 lightning strikes hit Douglas County Sept. 3. Two small fires were contained near Umpqua and Roseburg. Aerial and ground patrols continue today, with 36 cameras scanning for smoke. Fire danger remains HIGH. More updates coming, incl. Dad’s Creek Fire.

entry.title: Road Work Brings Delays to Stewart Parkway in Roseburg
entry.summary: Expect moderate delays on NW Stewart Pkwy through Oct. 20 for road work & ADA ramp upgrades. Businesses remain open, turn lane stays accessible. Overnight paving set for mid-late Oct. Wider bike lane coming soon. More info: cityofroseburg.org/departments/public-works

entry.title: Sutherlin Woman Faces Multiple Charges in Ongoing Investigation
entry.summary: A Sutherlin woman was released from jail after being charged with multiple counts of sexual abuse, witness tampering, and evidence tampering. Prosecutors added a Measure 11 charge of first-degree sexual abuse. She is due in Douglas County Circuit Court Friday.

entry.title: Dads Creek Fire is 60% contained as of Wednesday afternoon
entry.summary: GLENDALE — The 145-acre Dads Creek Fire, located about 5 miles west of Glendale, is now 60% contained according to the Douglas Forest Protective Association (DFPA).

entry.title: Roseburg Man Faces New Sex Abuse Charges Following Prior Conviction
entry.summary: Jerry Lee Thacker, 58, of Roseburg, already convicted of sex crimes against a minor, was arraigned on 15 new counts involving another alleged victim over more than a decade. He waived his right to a speedy trial and remains in custody.

entry.title: Myrtle Creek Woman Arraigned Following Child Injury Incident
entry.summary: Kati Ann Steensland, 31, of Myrtle Creek, was arraigned after a child was injured in Canyonville when her pickup reportedly ran over the child’s arm. She faces multiple misdemeanor charges and one felony hit-and-run charge. Bail was set at $10,000.

entry.title: Traveling Museum of Natural and Cultural History exhibit comes to Sutherlin Library
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Where did the world’s oldest shoes come from? How do you make a canoe not tip over? What are Camas bulbs? What’s a herring rake? How do you build an earth oven?

entry.title: More charges for child rapist
entry.summary: A Roseburg man who just last month was convicted of raping a 13-year-old girl was in court again Tuesday, this time to face charges alleging he sexually abused another girl over the span of more than a decade.

entry.title: Fremont Middle School students welcomed with WEB leaders
